leaflet.constituency: Brentford, Chiswick, Gunnersbury, Hounslow, Isleworth & Osterley

messages.title: BE A CHANGEMAKER...
messages.content: Join us as we make a better, fairer and greener borough.

messages.title: The Lib Dem difference: four steps to a fairer Britain
messages.content: Fairer taxes, a fair start for every child, a fair future, a fair deal from politicians.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Secure fairer funding for NHS Hounslow
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop the West Middlesex hospital from downsizing and support a fairer funding formula.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: End the stink of Mogden Sewage Works
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Mogden Sewage Works in Isleworth has long blighted the lives of many in our local community.
Help the jobless with smarter investment in education, says Councillor Dakers.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The last general election result evidently positioned the Lib Dems as the main challenger to Labour in the constituency. Tactical voting might be suggested as the way to prevent a split vote and enhance the potential for a Lib Dem victory.

issues.economy: Fairer taxes that put money back in your pocket.
issues.education: A fair start for every child, by cutting class sizes and providing funds for a one-on-one tuition.
issues.environment: A fair future by creating greener jobs, and a fair deal from the politicians
issues.governance: A fair deal from politicians with the right to sack corrupt MPs.
issues.health: Stop the West Middlesex hospital from downsizing and support a fairer funding formula for NHS Hounslow.

politicalExperience.achievements: Councillor Dakers is Leader of Hounslow Liberal Democrats and their prospective MP. He speaks for the Liberal Democrats on the London Assembly...

images.caption: Councillors Andrew Dakers and Barbara Reid outside the now closed Post Office
Andrew Dakers with Vince Cable MP and Cllr Barbara Reid, speaking up for residents on aircraft noise and Heathrow expansion.
